title: Leblanc is pretty much 100% pick/ban at worlds
body:
Maybe now Riot will finally realize that the revert was a mistake because this champion is disgustingly broken.

Its great that her E tether is basically half the length of the lane and impossible to escape cause counterplay.

replies.body:
The problem is that their rework was utter garbage. They simply don't know what to do with this champion...

I hate LB and her tether hitbox+range, mobility and burst, but at least they had the decency to revert it and admit their rework was a mistake. I wish they did this more often, this season is full of crap that should be reverted asap.

I liked the rework. They could have made the delay reduce with leblancs level so it was 0.5s lategame but still 1.5s in lane. Other than that I don't see what people's issues were, I had a lot more fun playing the reworked version

The problem is having  a quick comb/burst assassin turned into this clunky as shit mess that dies before her dmg goes off. 
But in return gets waveclear and absolutely retarded dmg output IF she goes off. 

The rework was a disaster, sorry.

That's why I've said like 5 times in this thread now, make the passive arm time reduce to 0.5 seconds at lategame

And I don't get this claim that she was clunky. All of her animations were the same besides w being a bit slower, which could be adjusted.

Same, the ult probably needed a better explanation towards how it worked, but it felt fine minus the wait time (of course others might disagree, but eh).
I tried it a couple times but I think I ended up not using the ult or messing it up because I was trying to read it while walking to lane or when I was alone in lane.

The ult took getting used to, but gave you much more interesting combo options and skill expression.
W -> RW -> W2 -> RW2 -> Q to chain your passive on multiple enemies in a teamfight was my personal favorite.

Shame I can't try practicing that stuff anymore.
I probably could've looked up a video or something for tips on how to use her ultimate properly, but yeah, the delay made you feel like a mage more than an assassin in teamfights or solo adventures.

1.5 second delay was fine in lane and early game, it meant your opponent could react but your damage was still strong. It was just too long lategame, but 0.75 or 0.5 seconds would have been fast enough while still giving some time to respond.

safety + damage
it works ok on {{champion:103}} because she gives up damage for safety and waveclear. 

{{champion:7}} has neither of those so she farms champions instead. When you beat her it's more like you survived rather than outplay her. This champion could've been a whole lot more than whatever this is.
To be fair LB doesn't have waveclear until she hits level 6. And she has to ult to clear waves.
LB is a pure assassin though and honestly waveclear is something assassins need less of, not more of.

She was more flexible and interesting in her rework, it just felt weird with the delay.
But it was infinitely better than the braindead thing that is pre rework LB.

Leblanc biggest strength is that her burst is very easy to apply and can be made from afar.
Double jump + E to catch a carry so the jungle can follow is super strong.
Double Q combo.
Etc.

If an assassin is picked in pro play despite their waveclear being 'weak', it say a lot about them.
She was far more broken with her rework then she is now.

Rengar and LB have historically been the least fun champs to play against when they're even a bit strong, then after they both get reworked and nerfed into a good spot where half the community isn't tearing their collective hair out, they listen to like 200 mains on reddit and revert them. Yeah current iteration is broken if played well but reworked version was just over powered untill she got nerfed and became useless beyond laning phase.
